page.title: 01SUNTRAP OF THE SOUTH
page.content: EASTBOURNE LIES AT THE EASTERN END OF THE SOUTH DOWNS. THE BUILT UP AREA IS SITUATED BETWEEN THE SCARP FOOT AND THE MARSHLAND TO THE WEST. MUCH OF THE BLOCK IS DOWNLAND WHISH IS USED FOR RECREATION AND AGRICULTURE. THE DOWNS ARE A NATURE CONSERVANCY AREA AS WELL AS AN AREA OF OUTSTANDING BEAUTY. PEOPLE HAVE LIVED ON THE DOWNS SINCE THE STONE AGE BUT THE TOWN DID NOT BECOME PROMINENT UNTIL SEA BATHING BECAME POPULAR IN THE 19TH CENTURY.THOUGH MODERN HOUSING ESTATES HAVE BEEN BUILT MANY OLD BUILDINGS HAVE BEEN CONVERTED INTO FLATS. THERE IS A LOT OF OPEN PARKLAND AND ALLOTMENT AREA FOR THE PUBLIC TO USE. GOLF AND WALKING ARE PERHAPS THE MOST POPULAR RECREATIONS ON THE DOWNS.
